subject: Testing static Properties
msgSnippet: Hi, all. I have a testing scenario I need help with. The application I am working on has a class called AppProperties. This class has a lot of static methods
messageBody:
Hi, all. I have a testing scenario I need help with. The application I
am working on has a class called AppProperties. This class has a lot
of static methods on it for loading properties files and getting
properties back out:

public void loadProperties() {
//reads properties from classpath
AppProperties.addResource("app.properties");
AppProperties.addResource("MessageResources.properties");
}

public void performTest() {
boolean test = AppProperties.getBoolean("app.perform.test");
if (test) {
...
}
}

This scenario is not very testable. I like the idea of a static class
to pull application properties from, but it makes testing more
difficult. I could load the AppProperties object in the setUp (that is
my solution to get it working until I get better suggestions), but it
seems like the app should be designed a little differently. How would
something like this be handled in IoC (DI) projects?

Thanks for any input.

Michael.
